info.name: Bustin' at the Blue Diamond

The library image was generated using the ChatGPT artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.chatgpt.com, using the following prompt: "Draw a square picture of a retro Las Vegas casino scene at night, large neon sign reading 'Blue Diamond Casino Las Vegas', glowing blue lights in futuristic fan-shaped design, giant diamond logo, 1950s classic cars parked in front, bustling crowd, cinematic lighting, vibrant neon colors, ultra-detailed, vintage atmosphere, hyperrealistic illustration."
info.description: Experience the thrill of greed, bluff, and risk—where one bold move can make you rich or leave you ruined.
info.ruleText:
A PLAYER'S TURN

  1. Auction a Card

      • Select one of the three open cards and place it in the auction area. Immediately refill the open spot by drawing from the stack.
      • Each player secretly bids any number of chips (including zero). Reveal bids simultaneously.
      • The highest bid wins the card. Ties favor the starting player or the player closest clockwise.

    • Adjust Prices

      • Place all bids in the center of the table.
      • If no chips of a color were bid, that color drops to the bottom of the price chart.
      • If only one chip of a color was bid, that color drops by 1.
      • Of the remaining colors, the one(s) with the most chips increase by 2.
      • If a color's value reaches 11 or 12, reset it to 6 and pay out the difference (per symbol owned) to the players.

    • Redistribute Chips

      • Starting with the player after the auction winner and proceeding clockwise, players alternate selecting one Chip at a time from the center until all are redistributed.

    • Sell a Card

      • The current player may sell one card from their hand (excluding the just-won card).
      • Use the price chart to calculate the value.

    • Pass Turn

      • Pass to the next player. Continue until the end of the turn during which the last card is auctioned.

    END OF GAME

    • Add the money earned during the game to:
      • 1 per remaining Chip in hand.
      • Value of all remaining cards, sold per the price chart.
    • The player with the highest total wins.

    VARIANT

    In the final round, do not redistribute Chips. Any Chips bid are removed from the game.
info.helpText:
SETUP
  • Let everyone take a seat, then hit SETUP so that everyone has chips in hand and a single-coloured card in their seat area.
GAMEPLAY
  1. The randomly chosen starting player, or the current player, moves one of the three available cards above the chart into the AUCTION holder.
  2. Everyone presses the BID button and bids any amount using any combination of chips through the input window.
  3. Once everyone is done (e.g., all players have a check mark assigned to their seat), press the REVEAL BIDS button.
  4. The auction winner places their card in their seat area.
  5. Manually adjust the prices by moving the tokens on the chart.
  6. Have the players manually redistribute the chips, one at a time, by moving them into the holder under their player name.
  7. If cards are sold or dividends are paid, add the amount to the score counter at the player's seat. Move the sold card to the DISCARD pile. For dividend payments, adjust the value on the price chart.
  8. Then pass the turn using END ROUND button.
NOTE
  • The check marks and Xs can be clicked to toggle between each other.
END OF GAME
  • Each player sells all cards, adding the proceeds to their score counter, plus 1 point for each remaining chip in their hand.
